lines.text: Oh! I think I got it!
Reversing Rune! That spell that instantly turns things around!
What's that got to do with anything?
Easy! Let's say he fired his gun at the Go Wizard, but he cast Reversing Rune on the bullet!
It turned around in midair, and... bam! Return to sender!
...Hold on. That ain't how it works, is it?
You said that spell involves writing on a <c=#FF00FF>sticker,</c> then sticking that to the target.
How would he have stuck a sticker on a bullet that was movin' towards him like... a speedin' bullet?
...Well, I think I have some idea how-
And anyway, it looks like the wizard's the one who got hit, not the robber.
Are we sure? Maybe we can check his body a little more thoroughly for bullet holes...
N-no! Out of the question! We can't touch the evidence!
Seriously? That's... still such a stupid rule.
I mean, we're the police! Who ELSE would be touching the evidence?
It doesn't matter. Rules are rules. We wouldn't want to break any, now would we?
Ugh... step off, Seeker. She's right.
Alright, but I'm <c=#FF00FF>keeping this in mind.</c> I think I'm onto something I can use later.
